name: Families Against Cult Teachings and Abuses

episodes.title: india video 121320 38627
episodes.description:
I think everyone can relate to being lost and looking for something outside themselves, or having been manipulated and lead down the wrong path. Who hasn’t felt fooled at least once in there lives? I want to make sure that resources and therapeutic programs are availabie for those who want to restart their lives and move forward.

After receiving so many emails from victims of trafficking and high control groups looking for support and help in an effort to leave and reclaim their lives, I knew I wanted to do something to help. My mother and I have a Foundation, "The Catherine Oxenberg Foundation" that is collaborating with Families Against Cult Teachings - FACT.

episodes.title: WARNING: Katsura Kan, known cult leader, Nazi sympathizer and predator of students
episodes.description:
My beloved daughter had no chance against this wicked person, who I believe is a Nazi sympathizer as per his Facebook profile post (see video). As a result of Katsura Kan’s manipulations my daughter is dead, and he is promoting Hitler.

Amazingly, but not surprisingly, he was considered good enough to be hired by Naropa University in Boulder, CO, which is an accredited higher learning institution, where we believe he taught his students without any proper teachings credentials, the destructive dance of Butoh and its philosophy in the classroom which promoted pain, suffering, and death. We will look into what I believe is the undeserved accreditation of this university.

Thank you for watching,

Tibor Stern
On Behalf of the Sharoni Stern Estate
President of F.A.C.T., Inc.

For more information, please visit: https://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org/Memorial/

episodes.title: TEEN GIRL DIES FROM RELIGIOUS FAST PRESCRIBED BY GURU
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org   A 13-year-old girl in India took part in an extreme religious fast and died after over two months of not eating and having almost no sleep, according to reports. After calling off the fast, she fell into a coma and after two days, she died of cardiac arrest on Oct. 4th.

The parents - Laxmi Chand and Manshi Samdariya - have been booked under culpable homicide [causing death by negligence] and Juvenile Justice Act [cruelty against minors]," the spokesperson said.

"The entire nation should be ashamed that such a practice still exists. Her father's guru advised the family that if she fasted for 68 days, his business would be profitable," activist Achyut Rao told BBC Hindi."

This video is uploaded under terms of the United States Fair Use Act of 1976, subsection 107, for educational purposes as a warning to those people caught up in religious cults.

For information about currently active destructive groups or to get help for yourself or a loved one, please visit our website: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org

episodes.title: Gods of the New Age - Documentary - Full Version
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  This film explores the eerie world of ego-maniacal gurus and their Western counterparts, known as "New Agers". In a series of exclusive, candid interviews, you will share the thoughts of the Hindu "Master", and witness the blind devotion and unquestioning obedience of his disciples.

Gods of the New Age takes you from the rebellion against the values and morals of Christian belief seen in the early sixties and the mindless devotion toward the gurus who began to be worshiped as gods by their followers, to today's U.S corridors, American schoolrooms, and even some churches, where occultism and New Age techniques and practices are openly embraced.

Though this film is based on footage which is now decades old, it still uncovers the chilling parallels between today's Western culture which increasingly embraces occult philosophies and integrates it into music, film, and books, and where it may ultimately lead us.
This video is uploaded under terms of the United States Fair Use Act of 1976, subsection 107, for educational purposes as a warning to those people caught up in religious cults.

For information about currently active destructive groups or to get help for yourself or a loved one, please visit our website: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org

The original film and many others may be purchased at:

www.jeremiahfilms.com

episodes.title: Teen Mania Christian Cult Group
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org   Teen Mania International was an Evangelical Christian youth organization located in Dallas, Texas (formally Garden Valley, Texas). Teen Mania focused primarily on four key programs, with a few additional smaller endeavors. It was one of the largest Christian youth organizations in the U.S.

Its primary program included "Acquire the Fire" events, described by one writer as "a mix of pep rally, rock concert and church service," that were held in over 30 cities across the United States and Canada each year. The ministry focused much of its energy towards its domestic and overseas mission trips, operated under the title "Global Expeditions". Teen Mania previously operated a one-year-long residential leadership training program on its campus, titled the Honor Academy, aimed towards high school graduates, and college students.

The ministry faced criticism for its use of overtly militaristic symbolism, as well as techniques that have been compared as similar to military training. It has also been criticized by some former interns and employees for what they characterize as spiritual abuse and financial mismanagement. In its final years it faced significant financial difficulties, including a foreclosure on their campus, a lawsuit for breach of contract, and over $5.2 million in negative assets.

This video is uploaded under terms of the United States Fair Use Act of 1976, subsection 107, for educational purposes as a warning to those people caught up in religious cults.

For information about currently active destructive groups or to get help for yourself or a loved one, please visit our website: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org

episodes.title: Ticket to Heaven - Movie About Religious Brainwashing
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  In turmoil following the break-up of a longtime relationship, David (Nick Mancuso) seeks something to give him a new direction and falls in with a religious cult. Before long, David has been completely brainwashed by the group and has receded from his old life. When his dedicated buddy, Larry (Saul Rubinek), tracks him down and discovers the reality of his situation, he proceeds to rally David's family and other friends to remove him from the cult and shake its influence.

From the NY Times: ''TICKET TO HEAVEN'' is an absorbing, frightening, entirely believable movie, which is particularly amazing in view of its subject matter. This is the story of a young man who is seduced into joining a religious cult, and it presents the group's indoctrination process in terms that are graphic, terrifyingly plausible and all too easy to understand. It is also the story of his friends and relatives' efforts to get him back, after he has become a near-zombie with close-cropped hair and a fierce but automatic dedication to the cult's leader. A credit at the end of the movie says this is fiction. That credit is the one thing about ''Ticket to Heaven'' that is genuinely funny.

For information about currently active destructive groups or to get help for yourself or a loved one, please visit our website: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org

episodes.title: Billboard erected in Scientology's backyard to reconnect with lost children
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  ABC News tells the story of Phil and Willie Jones who left the Church of Scientology after four decades, but say their two children, Emily and Michael, remain inside and have disconnected from them completely. Now, in a desperate attempt to talk with them again, they have erected a billboard near the church, which will be seen by an estimated 1 million people in the area.

The Church allegedly told one billboard company they contacted that it would spend "millions of dollars" on billboards if the company would just turn down the Jones's request for signage.

episodes.title: ABC Report on Scientology with Alex Gibney -- 'Going Clear - Scientology and the Prison of Belief'
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Alex Gibney is an Oscar-winning documentary director who explores the world of Scientology in his new film 'Going Clear - Scientology and the Prison of Belief'. He tells Steve Cannane the church should lose its tax free status because of its pattern of cruelty and, in the past, criminality.

STEVE CANNANE, PRESENTER: The church of scientology should lose its tax free status.

That's the view of Academy Award winning documentary maker Alex Gibney. 

Who explores the world of Scientology in his latest film.

The director says a pattern of cruelty and in the past criminality should disqualify the Church of Scientology from being considered a charity.

Alex Gibney's film, 'Going Clear - Scientology and the Prison of Belief', includes allegations that Nicole Kidman had her phone tapped, by order of Scientology's leader, David Miscavige. 

Alex Gibney is in Australia as a guest of the Sydney Film Festival, where he has three films in the program.

This video is presented for educational purposes only.

For more information about currently active destructive groups, please visit our non-profit's website: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org

episodes.title: Church of Scientology - Top Ten FACTS
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Though Scientology is over 60 years old, it wasn’t until the mid-2000’s that it started to garner a lot of media attention. The attention has spanned from general critiques about the belief system to downright labeling the religion as a strong cult.

Regardless of personal opinion on the Church of Scientology, it’s difficult to deny that it does have a rather interesting history that was chronicled in HBO’s Going Clear documentary. In this installment, we’re going to dive into L. Ron Hubbard’s creation and syphon out ten of the most interesting tidbits about the church, its beliefs, and some of its sordid past.

10. The Human Spirit 
9. Thetans and Telekinesis 
8. The True Belief System was Once Hidden
7. Scientologists Generally Shy Away from Xenu
6. “Disconnecting”
5. The Fight for Tax Exemption
4. Germany Refuses to Recognize Scientology as a Religion
3. France Considers it a Cult
2. ?
1. ?

This report from our China Editor, Carrie Gracie.

episodes.title: Guy Miller Ministries - FACT / CBS Investigation & Expose
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Beginning in February, FACT published a four-part series in its newsletter quoting people who it says are former members of Guy Miller Ministries. No names were released. 

http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org/News/Blog.php

"I would recommend to anyone that reads this that if someone tries to take you to this 'church,' run, run far and run fast because it will probably damage your life," FACT quotes one anonymous source as saying.

Another anonymous source claims that Miller and church employees put pressure on congregants to give special donations to the pastor "for Miller to use as he wishes," while another alleges that church funds were used to send Miller and his family on vacations to "Disney or Myrtle Beach."

FACT claims that former church members complained of physical abuse, including repeated paddling and spankings, and that when people left the church, other church members --- including members of their own families --- were told by Miller to break off all contact with them.

For more information, visit http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org/News/Blog.php

episodes.title: Word of Faith Fellowship (WOFF) - Victim Testimony - Alleged Destructive Cult - ABC News
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Gay churchgoer Matthew Fenner claims he was kidnapped and beaten by five fellow members of a congregation who thought the Holy attack would rid him of 'homosexual demons’.

Matthew Fenner claims the group attacked him because he's gay.

They all belong to the Word of Faith Fellowship in Spindale, North Carolina.

Five were indicted on simple assault and kidnapping charges and one is also charged with assault by strangulation.

The church's attorney insists it 'does not target members who are gay'.

Grand jury met on Monday and Mr. Fenner says his mother and brother testified against him.

episodes.title: TED TALK - AN INSIDER'S PERSPECTIVE ON CULTS AND EXTREMIST MOVEMENTS
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org 

Diane Benscoter talks about how she joined the Moonies -- and stayed for five long years.

episodes.title: Grand Jury Finds Widespread Child Sex Abuse By Almost 50 Priests For Over 40 Years
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Hundreds of children in western Pennsylvania were sexually assaulted by about 50 Roman Catholic priests over four decades while bishops covered up their actions, according to a state grand jury report released on Tuesday.

"The heinous crimes these children endured are absolutely unconscionable," Kane told reporters in unveiling the report, based on a two-year investigation. "These predators desecrated a sacred trust and preyed upon their victims in the very places where they should have felt most safe."

"The report found that former Altoona-Johnstown Diocese Bishop James Hogan, who died in 2005, and his successor, Joseph Adamec, who retired in 2011, worked to cover pedophile priests' tracks and that some local law enforcement agencies also avoided investigating abuse allegations, said state Attorney General Kathleen Kane."

episodes.title: Members Of FLDS Charged With Fraud and Money Laundering
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Eleven leaders of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints have been indicted on conspiracy charges related to government nutrition assistance programs and money laundering.

"This is a clear drawing of that magical line in that sand that government will not tolerate crimes committed in the name of religion."

There are some 30,000 members of the cult- all of whom need specialized counseling which they are not getting. The many millions of dollars in the cult coffers should be directed to helping people- and getting them job training, education, health care and much more.

episodes.title: MADONNA'S KABBALAH CENTRE... IS IT A CULT?
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  One of the leading cult experts talks about how the Kabbalah centre is using undue influence to break up families, marriages, friendships, financially exploit members causing job loss, home loss, and more, according to many different complaints received by his organization.

According to Rick Ross, its members are being psychologically and emotionally manipulated through coercive persuasion.

Please share this with anyone you know who may be involved with the Kabbalah Centre in case they are being manipulated and exploited.

For more information about currently active destructive cults in existence today, please visit our non-profit organization's website: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org 

Subscribe to our channel for more cult related videos.

episodes.title: Destructive Cult Groups and Their Leaders -- with Cult Expert Rick Alan Ross
episodes.description: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Rick Alan Ross defines what comprises a cult, how to deprogram victims, and the most dangerous currently active cults in this exploration of the destructive groups that can tear people out of their families and from society.

episodes.title: WHAT'S IT LIKE INSIDE A HIGH-CONTROL RELIGIOUS GROUP?
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Potters House, a.k.a. The Door, Victory Chapel - Is this a Church or Cult? Experts agree that many branches of this organization operate as a high-control / high-demand cult. 

If you are involved with a religious organization of any kind, please watch this video to learn some of the warning signs of how a religious high-control / high-demand group operates. 

Perhaps you can see similarities within your group?

The information found within this 3 minute video could potentially save your life, or that of your loved ones. Please share with others.

episodes.title: OUR MISSION AT F.A.C.T.
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org   Families Against Cult Teachings, Inc. (F.A.C.T.) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to raising awareness and educating about destructive high-control / high-demand groups in the United States and abroad. Providing aid is also a top priority, for which we offer care, guidance, and various kinds of support for victims of undue influence, abuse (minor and adult), human trafficking (sex and labor) and exploitation of all kinds.

No one ever gets trapped in an abusive high-control group of their own free will. Initially, victims innocently join a church, a non-profit group trying to save the oceans, a self-help group or attend yoga classes. A child on the street gets pulled into a sex trafficking ring. A naive student in school gets recruited on campus. People are curious about practicing an Eastern religion or to learn meditation. 

According to the experts, there are over 5000 different high-control groups in the U.S. alone with more than four million members. FACT is one of the few organizations in existence whose mission it is to expose these groups for what they truly are and to help those afflicted by them. 


KEY OBJECTIVES:

• Rescuing minors and adults from abusive high-control situations and groups
• Education in high-schools / universities to inform and warn students
• Providing guidance and support to families of victims in high-control groups
• Working with the law to hold criminal groups accountable for their actions
• Conducting investigative research on destructive groups
• Creating and distributing educational awareness materials
• Monitoring of news sources and sharing the information with the public
• Holding anti-cult events to raise awareness with the general public

episodes.title: Natacha Tormey  - Children of God - Cult Victim
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Growing up inside The Children of God cult, Natacha Tormey was sexually abused, made to live in a compound and taught to fear the outside world.

At the age of 18 she escaped and now, eleven years later, she feels strong enough to tell her story.

'I was sexually abused from the age of four - on several occasions,' the cult survivor revealed as she poured her heart out to Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford on ITV's This Morning.

'It was a very sexualised environment. It started out innocently with the idea that anything done in love is OK, but it became more bizarre where husband and wives were expected to share their partners with others.

'Then it went one step further with flirty fishing - where women were told to use their bodies to win men (converts) to God, often in return for a donation.'

episodes.title: Mind Control Made Easy - an educational film by Carey Burtt
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  An excellent video which outlines and simplifies the cult / high-control group recruitment and indoctrination process. A MUST WATCH for any parent or student!

For more information about current destructive cults in existence today, visit our non-profit organization's website: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org/

episodes.title: Church or Cult Power Point
episodes.description: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org   A simple video to help you figure out if your church or group is safe or if they're destructive and cult like. Thought provoking questions that will help you decide (what you probably already know).

episodes.title: The Sharon Stern Story
episodes.description:
http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  Tibor Stern, president of F.A.C.T., and 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, tells the tragic story of his daughter who was manipulated and controlled by a cult leader who drove her to suicide. The leader's name was Katsura Kan and he was her teacher at Naropa University in Boulder, CO; a school with a long history of cultic abuse with students.

This true story is highly documented (backed by evidence).

The complete story of Sharon Stern can be found here: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org/Memorial/

The history of Naropa University can be found here: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org/Cult-Education/Naropa-University-Cults/

episodes.title: F.A.C.T. Interview Series -- Nathalie Gomez
episodes.description: http://www.familiesagainstcultteachings.org  An interview with the mother of Jevany Soto, a cult victim.
